description: '''Elmer Lee Fields''' (born April 26, 1950) is an American [[soul music|soul]] singer, sometimes nicknamed "Little JB" for his physical and vocal resemblance with [[James Brown]]. He has recorded with [[Kool and the Gang]], Hip Huggers, [[O. V. Wright]], [[Darrell Banks]], and [[Little Royal and The Swingmasters|Little Royal]]. Fields has also worked with musicians such as  [[B. B. King]], [[Clarence Carter]], [[Dr. John]], [[Tyrone Davis]], Johnny Taylor, [[Denise LaSalle]], [[Bobby Bland|Bobby Blue Bland]], [[Betty Wright]], [[The Manhattans]], [[Little Milton]] and [[Bobby Womack]]. He recorded his first single in 1969 and is still active. His recent work is with The Expressions, including the albums ''Faithful Man'' (2012), ''Special Night'' (2017), and ''It Rains Love'' (2019). In 2014, he provided additional vocals for the [[James Brown]] biographical movie, ''[[Get On Up (film)|Get On Up]]''.
